meanings.definition: Of or relating to a process in which volume remains constant.
meanings.sent1: During the isochoric process, the volume of the gas does not change.
meanings.sent2: The isochoric system kept the volume of the liquid constant.
meanings.sent3: The isochoric balloon refused to expand, much to the disappointment of the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her isochoric determination to maintain her weight was like a rock in the storm of diet trends.
meanings.sent5: The isochoric container held its contents tightly, like a hug that never loosened.

meanings.sent1: The isochoric reaction in the lab was carefully monitored by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: The isochoric heating process ensured the volume of the substance stayed the same.
meanings.sent3: The isochoric cake recipe guaranteed a perfectly shaped dessert every time.
meanings.sent4: His isochoric focus on the task at hand was unwavering, like a laser beam.
meanings.sent5: The isochoric walls of the room seemed to enclose the space in a comforting embrace.
